com.aheaditec.wrapper.interfaces

Interface CardConnection


  • public interface CardConnection

    Implementation of this interface can be used to communicate with smartcard. All methods describe must be synchronous, any asynchronous events should be implemented above this layer.

    Synchronous implementation of this interface is needed for use in SDK.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getAtr()
      Retrieves ATR (Answer To Reset) of connected smartcard.
      boolean reset()
      Resets connection to smartcard.
      com.aheaditec.wrapper.response.ReaderResponse sendAPDU(byte[] command)
      Sends APDU command in for of byte array to smartcard.

    • Method Detail

      • sendAPDU

        com.aheaditec.wrapper.response.ReaderResponse sendAPDU(@NonNull
                                                       byte[] command)

        Sends APDU command in for of byte array to smartcard. APDU command has to be complete, with header and data bytes in correct format. Wikipedia is a good starting point for APDU format. Returns instance of ReaderResponse containing card response status.

        Note, that implementations of this methods should follow the synchronous execution and if you need asynchronous calls to this method, you should wrap implementation of this method to AsyncTask.

        Parameters:
        command - Byte array representing APDU command.
        Returns:
        ReaderResponse object containing response from card and/or status information.

      • getAtr

        @Nullable
byte[] getAtr()

        Retrieves ATR (Answer To Reset) of connected smartcard. ATR is contained inside the ReaderResponse object which is returned by this method. You can retrieve it by calling:

        Note, that implementations of this methods should follow the synchronous execution and if you need asynchronous calls to this method, you should wrap implementation of this method to AsyncTask.

        Returns:
        Byte[] containing ATR data and/or status information.

      • reset

        boolean reset()

        Resets connection to smartcard. After this method finishes, this instance of CardConnection should remain valid and available for calling smartcard. Any calls to smartcard after calling this method and before its successful finish can produce undefined behavior.

        Note, that implementations of this methods should follow the synchronous execution and if you need asynchronous calls to this method, you should wrap implementation of this method to AsyncTask.

        Returns:
        Boolean true if reset was successful and you can keep using this object to call smartcard.
